lines.text: Enter TITUS, bearing arrows with letters at the  ends of them with him, MARCUS, Young LUCIUS,  PUBLIUS, SEMPRONIUS, CAIUS, and other Gentlemen, with bows

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Come, Marcus come, kinsmen this is the way. Sir boy, now let me see your archery Look ye draw home enough, and tis there straight. Terras Astraea reliquit: Be you rememberd, Marcus, shes gone, shes fled. Sirs, take you to your tools. You, cousins, shall Go sound the ocean, and cast your nets Happily you may catch her in the sea Yet theres as little justice as at land: No Publius and Sempronius, you must do it Tis you must dig with mattock and with spade, And pierce the inmost centre of the earth: Then, when you come to Plutos region, I pray you, deliver him this petition Tell him, it is for justice and for aid, And that it comes from old Andronicus, Shaken with sorrows in ungrateful Rome. Ah, Rome! Well, well I made thee miserable What time I threw the peoples suffrages On him that thus doth tyrannize oer me. Go, get you gone and pray be careful all, And leave you not a manofwar unsearchd: This wicked emperor may have shippd her hence And, kinsmen, then we may go pipe for justice.

lines.speaker: marcus andronicus
lines.text: O Publius, is not this a heavy case, To see thy noble uncle thus distract

lines.speaker: publius
lines.text: Therefore, my lord, it highly us concerns By day and night to attend him carefully, And feed his humour kindly as we may, Till time beget some careful remedy.

lines.speaker: marcus andronicus
lines.text: Kinsmen, his sorrows are past remedy. Join with the Goths and with revengeful war Take wreak on Rome for this ingratitude, And vengeance on the traitor Saturnine.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Publius, how now! how now, my masters! What, have you met with her

lines.speaker: publius
lines.text: No, my good lord but Pluto sends you word, If you will have Revenge from hell, you shall: Marry, for Justice, she is so employd, He thinks, with Jove in heaven, or somewhere else, So that perforce you must needs stay a time.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: He doth me wrong to feed me with delays. Ill dive into the burning lake below, And pull her out of Acheron by the heels. Marcus, we are but shrubs, no cedars we No bigboned men framed of the Cyclops size But metal, Marcus, steel to the very back, Yet wrung with wrongs more than our backs can bear: And, sith theres no justice in earth nor hell, We will solicit heaven and move the gods To send down Justice for to wreak our wrongs. Come, to this gear. You are a good archer, Marcus Ad Jovem, thats for you: here, Ad Apollinem: Ad Martem, thats for myself: Here, boy, to Pallas: here, to Mercury: To Saturn, Caius, not to Saturnine You were as good to shoot against the wind. To it, boy! Marcus, loose when I bid. Of my word, I have written to effect Theres not a god left unsolicited.
He gives them the arrows

lines.speaker: marcus andronicus
lines.text: Kinsmen, shoot all your shafts into the court: We will afflict the emperor in his pride.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Now, masters, draw. O, well said, Lucius! Good boy, in Virgos lap give it Pallas.
They shoot

lines.speaker: marcus andronicus
lines.text: My lord, I aim a mile beyond the moon Your letter is with Jupiter by this.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Ha, ha! Publius, Publius, what hast thou done See, see, thou hast shot off one of Taurus horns.

lines.speaker: marcus andronicus
lines.text: This was the sport, my lord: when Publius shot, The Bull, being galld, gave Aries such a knock That down fell both the Rams horns in the court And who should find them but the empress villain She laughd, and told the Moor he should not choose But give them to his master for a present.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Why, there it goes: God give his lordship joy! News, news from heaven! Marcus, the post is come. Sirrah, what tidings have you any letters Shall I have justice what says Jupiter
Enter a Clown, with a basket, and two pigeons in it

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: O, the gibbetmaker! he says that he hath taken them down again, for the man must not be hanged till the next week.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: But what says Jupiter, I ask thee

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Alas, sir, I know not Jupiter I never drank with him in all my life.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Why, villain, art not thou the carrier

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Ay, of my pigeons, sir nothing else.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Why, didst thou not come from heaven

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: From heaven! alas, sir, I never came there     God forbid I should be so bold to press to heaven in my young days. Why, I am going with my pigeons to the tribunal plebs, to take up a matter of brawl betwixt my uncle and one of the emperials men.

lines.speaker: marcus andronicus
lines.text: Why, sir, that is as fit as can be to serve for your oration and let him deliver the pigeons to the emperor from you.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Tell me, can you deliver an oration to the emperor with a grace

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Nay, truly, sir, I could never say grace in all my life.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Sirrah, come hither: make no more ado, But give your pigeons to the emperor: By me thou shalt have justice at his hands. Hold, hold meanwhile heres money for thy charges. Give me pen and ink. Sirrah, can you with a grace deliver a supplication

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: Ay, sir.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Then here is a supplication for you. And when you come to him, at the first approach you must kneel, then kiss his foot, then deliver up your pigeons, and then look for your reward. Ill be at hand, sir see you do it bravely.

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: I warrant you, sir, let me alone.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Sirrah, hast thou a knife come, let me see it. Here, Marcus, fold it in the oration For thou hast made it like an humble suppliant. And when thou hast given it the emperor, Knock at my door, and tell me what he says.

lines.speaker: clown
lines.text: God be with you, sir I will.

lines.speaker: titus andronicus
lines.text: Come, Marcus, let us go. Publius, follow me.
Exeunt
